entry.title: Awesome Fiber Updates on May 28, 2023
entry.content:
âš™ï¸ Middlewares / ğŸ§¬ Core

  • Adaptor (â­37k) - Converter for net/http handlers to/from Fiber request handlers.
  • Earlydata (â­37k) - Early data support for Fiber.
  • Helmet (â­37k) - Helps secure your apps by setting various HTTP headers.
  • Idempotency (â­37k) - Idempotency middleware for Fiber allows for fault-tolerant APIs where duplicate requests.
  • Keyauth (â­37k) - Key auth middleware provides a key based authentication.
  • Redirect (â­37k) - Redirect middleware for Fiber.
  • Rewrite (â­37k) - Rewrite middleware rewrites the URL path based on provided rules. It can be helpful for backward compatibility or just creating cleaner and more descriptive links.

ğŸ“ Recipes / ğŸŒ± Third Party

entry.title: Awesome Fiber Updates on Feb 28, 2022
entry.content:
âš™ï¸ Middlewares / ğŸ§¬ Core

  • BasicAuth (â­37k) - Basic auth middleware provides an HTTP basic authentication. It calls the next handler for valid credentials and 401 Unauthorized for missing or invalid credentials.
  • Cache (â­37k) - Intercept and cache responses.
  • CORS (â­37k) - Enable cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) with various options.
  • CSRF (â­37k) - Protect from CSRF exploits.
  • Encrypt Cookie (â­37k) - Encrypt middleware which encrypts cookie values.
  • ETag (â­37k) - ETag middleware that lets caches be more efficient and save bandwidth, as a web server does not need to resend a full response if the content has not changed.
  • Expvar (â­37k) - Expvar middleware that serves via its HTTP server runtime exposed variants in the JSON format.
  • Favicon (â­37k) - Ignore favicon from logs or serve from memory if a file path is provided.
  • FileSystem (â­37k) - FileSystem middleware for Fiber, special thanks and credits to Alireza Salary.
  • Limiter (â­37k) - Rate-limiting middleware. Use to limit repeated requests to public APIs and/or endpoints such as password reset.
  • Logger (â­37k) - HTTP request/response logger.
  • Monitor (â­37k) - Monitor middleware that reports server metrics, inspired by express-status-monitor.
  • Pprof (â­37k) - Pprof middleware that serves via its HTTP server runtime profiling data in the format expected by the pprof visualization tool.
  • Proxy (â­37k) - Allows you to proxy requests to a multiple servers.
  • Recover (â­37k) - Recover middleware recovers from panics anywhere in the stack chain and handles the control to the centralized ErrorHandler.
  • RequestID (â­37k) - Adds a requestid to every request.
  • Session (â­37k) - Session middleware. NOTE: This middleware uses our Storage package.
  • Skip (â­37k) - Skip middleware that skips a wrapped handler is a predicate is true.
  • Timeout (â­37k) - Adds a max time for a request and forwards to ErrorHandler if it is exceeded.

âš™ï¸ Middlewares / ğŸ”— External

  • storage (â­298) - Premade storage drivers that implement the Storage interface, designed to be used with various Fiber middlewares.
  • template (â­294) - This package contains 8 template engines that can be used with Fiber v1.10.x Go version 1.13 or higher is required.

âš™ï¸ Middlewares / â€ğŸ’» Contrib

  • fibersentry (â­262) - Sentry support for Fiber.
  • fiberzap (â­262) - Zap logging support for Fiber.
  • otelfiber (â­262) - OpenTelemetry support for Fiber.
  • paseto (â­262) - PASETO returns a Web Token (PASETO) auth middleware.
  • swagger (â­262) - Swagger middleware for Fiber. The middleware handles Swagger UI.

ğŸ“ Recipes / ğŸŒ± Third Party

  • gofiber/recipes (â­3.3k) - Official Fiber cookbook.

ğŸ› ï¸ Tools / ğŸŒ± Third Party

  • go-dawn/dawn (â­19) - Dawn is an opinionated web framework that provides rapid development capabilities which on top of Fiber.
  • tompston/gomakeme (â­11) - Generate boilerplate + endpoints for Fiber or Gin REST APIs.

ğŸ“– Articles / ğŸŒ± Third Party

  • Go Fiber by Examples: How can the Fiber Web Framework be useful?
  • Build a RESTful API on Go: Fiber, PostgreSQL, JWT and Swagger docs in isolated Docker containers
  • Getting started with Fiber
